title: current stage1 rustc segfaults when compiled without jemalloc on FreeBSD 9.2
body:
Affects all attempts to build the compiler from revision 98d4d4997e300bb712254a67184caf8892af4be0 (with snapshot 9e4e524) forward. Last "good" release was 87dce0c138af6887704fc2379b7a75e05a1e8b18.

Build output:

```
CFG_LLVM_LINKAGE_FILE=/usr/home/aidan/rust/rust2/rust/x86_64-unknown-freebsd/rt/llvmdeps.rs LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/home/aidan/rust/rust2/rust/x86_64-unknown-freebsd/stage1/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH   x86_64-unknown-freebsd/stage1/bin/rustc --cfg stage1  -O --cfg rtopt --cfg debug -C prefer-dynamic --target=x86_64-unknown-freebsd  -D warnings -L "x86_64-unknown-freebsd/rt" -L "/usr/home/aidan/rust/rust2/rust/x86_64-unknown-freebsd/llvm/Release+Asserts/lib" -L ""  --out-dir x86_64-unknown-freebsd/stage1/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-freebsd/lib -C extra-filename=-4e7c5e5c /home/aidan/rust/rust2/rust/src/libcore/lib.rs
/home/aidan/rust/rust2/rust/mk/target.mk:165: recipe for target 'x86_64-unknown-freebsd/stage1/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-freebsd/lib/stamp.core' failed
gmake: *** [x86_64-unknown-freebsd/stage1/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-freebsd/lib/stamp.core] Segmentation fault: 11
```

When compiling with this command line:

```
RUST_LOG=debug CFG_LLVM_LINKAGE_FILE=/usr/home/aidan/rust/rust2/rust/x86_64-unknown-freebsd/rt/llvmdeps.rs LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/home/aidan/rust/rust2/rust/x86_64-unknown-freebsd/stage1/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH   x86_64-unknown-freebsd/stage1/bin/rustc --cfg stage1  -O --cfg rtopt --cfg debug -C prefer-dynamic --target=x86_64-unknown-freebsd  -D warnings -L "x86_64-unknown-freebsd/rt" -L "/usr/home/aidan/rust/rust2/rust/x86_64-unknown-freebsd/llvm/Release+Asserts/lib" -L ""  --out-dir x86_64-unknown-freebsd/stage1/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-freebsd/lib -C extra-filename=-4e7c5e5c -Z time-passes /home/aidan/rust/rust2/rust/src/libcore/lib.rs
```

Yields [this debug log tail](http://pastebin.mozilla.org/8382984)

Ran configure as:

```
./configure --disable-jemalloc --prefix=/pkg/rust2 --local-rust-root=/pkg/rust2 --libdir=/pkg/rust2/lib --enable-debug
```

uname -a output (not that it should matter much):

```
FreeBSD freebsd 9.2-RELEASE FreeBSD 9.2-RELEASE #0 r+2315ea3: Fri Dec 20 12:48:50 PST 2013     root@build.ixsystems.com:/tank/home/jkh/checkout/freenas/os-base/amd64/tank/home/jkh/checkout/freenas/FreeBSD/src/sys/FREENAS.amd64  amd64
```

(Note that I've updated the base FreeBSD installation to run w/ clang instead of gcc.)

Builds and runs fine when jemalloc is enabled, but if we assume the system allocator works, it would mean there's a bug somewhere in rustc's (or llvm's) code generation: some investigation showed the segfault occurred due to memory corruption in the AST. I suspect this problem will be reproducable with FreeBSD 10.
